name: City Hotel

reviews.title: Very friendly staff
reviews.text: Nice comfrotable rooms, if a little dull. Good location right in the centre of Derry, with views over the Peace Bridge. The breakfast was very good. The staff were what made this hotel, they were all friendly, welcoming and informative.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay throughout staff pleasant and extremely helpful. Food and leisure facility 5star. Situated central rooms clean parking available the swimming pool was amazing quiet peaceful and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Excellent and professional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights as part of a CIE tour. The hotel is located a short walk from the city wall and the Tower museum. It was very busy, but the staff was friendly and efficient. Meals were good. Rooms were comfortable and we had a nice view from our windows.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Visiting Derry was a highlight of our trip and staying at the City Hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel is very nice and well located. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Incredible city near the Peace Bridge

reviews.text: We were able to walk, walk, walk...make sure you walk across the Peace Bridge to the other side of Derry. This city is filled with Northern Ireland's history and one can walk to some very interesting sites.
reviews.title: Fantastic accommodation and service

reviews.text: Located in the city centre this hotel is ideally suited for discovering Derry on foot. Reception staff are friendly and efficient. The restaurant food is excellent value for money and no request is a problem to the staff. We stayed during the jazz festival and because of this the hotel was filled to capacity as a result of this getting a drink became time consuming as lobby was filled with jazz enthusiasts. My only gripe was the king size bed where two mattresses were pushed together and I kept finding the joint during the night. I still would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city
reviews.title: Prime location Hotel

reviews.text: On Sunday 5th May, 5 family enjoyed a lovely meal in Thompsons Restaurant, City Hotel. We opted for the 2 x 2 courses for 2 and a bottle of wine for £35 and one other for £17. The setting was lovely as the Tony hendley Band were playing as we had our meal. I had salmon which was very tasty, others had steak(medium rare), pork and chicken. Everyone was impressed with the meal and generous side orders. Deserts also did not disappoint - an excellent apple and cinnimon crumble(very generous portion) hot chocolate brownies, were the best. Waitress was very attentive and made the experience all the more positive. Highly recommended!!!
reviews.title: Excellent service and enjoyable experience in City Hotel Restaurant

reviews.text: The city of culture really lived up to it's name this weekend and the City Hotel made our weekend four really enjoyable days and nights. Most of the entertainment during the jazz festival was free. Can't wait until August when the Fleadh Cheoil (traditional irish music festival) .The staff at the City Hotel are really friendly and helpful.Food at the hotel is good and reasonably priced. There is live music as far as I know each weekend Friday and Saturday nights and no cover charge. Would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Derry it's central and plenty bars and restaurants around the hotel. No need to take taxis as the hotel is central to all the entertainment.l
reviews.title: FAB WEEKEND AT JAZZ FESTIVAL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Derry is a very walkable city anyway but this hotel is smack bang in the middle of virtually everything, so couldn't ask for a better location.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: Seriously busy as it was Jazz Festival weekend so great buzz everywhere especially in the hotel lobby which had a number of free gigs.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel; staff was amazing

reviews.text: I have stayed here a number of times on business and it is your standard hotel. The rooms I have stayed in have been 'superior rooms' and have been clean and comfortable. I have always requested a quiet room as I need my sleep and hotel noise does tend to keep me up!
reviews.title: Basic but clean
Lovely hotel and staff
reviews.text: The breakfast is average and mostly very plain but as I have stayed for business I have just needed something basic but I would be disappointed if I was staying for pleasure. Again, my eternal bugbear cropped up - the curse of terrible coffee.

One thing I would advise against is getting room service. I have had this a number of times and it has never been good. I won't be getting it again! The last time my meal had clearly been microwaved - ugh!
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: The staff in the City Hotel are really nice and always very helpful. If you want to avail of one of the complimentary parking spaces then get in early as they fill up quickly! Otherwise you are parking in the shopping centre next door and are paying for it!
reviews.title: Nice hotel.

reviews.text: Me and my mum enjoyed a two nite stay here with evening meal got it on special and was well worth it rooms are immaculate and food is to die for. The hotel is in a brilliant location as derry has plenty to c and do will definitely be back :)
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and must I say we surely enjoyed it!
reviews.title: Fab Stay

reviews.text: It was a 2BB&D and we loved every bit of it, food was tasty and breakfast nice.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: The rooms are nice and a great location. Free car park but not in the hotel.
reviews.title: Conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was nice and busy and that's great to see.
reviews.title: Great location, city centre hotel with parking.

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for one night while visiting friends who live in the area. It is a good hotel -very clean throughout .The bedrooms are large and functional but nothing special. They are however well insulated for sound and are very quiet. The staff are pleasant. The breakfast was nice enough but again nothing special. The evening meal was quite good and reasonably priced. The location of the Hotel is its best feature. It is right on the Foyle and near the City Walls and other places of interest. It is an ideal base to tour the city.
reviews.title: Good locations/average hotel

description: Contemporary hotel located on the bend of River Foyle, 200 yards from Guildhall - Many rooms overlook these points of interest.
